config_element.name: StubInt
config_element.label: Dummy integer MIB entry
config_element.description_user: A MIB integer entry that can be harmlessly read or written, e.g., for testing.

config_element.name: StubStr
config_element.label: Dummy string MIB entry
config_element.description_user: A MIB string entry that can be harmlessly read or written, e.g., for testing.

config_element.name: USBManufString
config_element.label: Manufacturer string descriptor
config_element.description_user: USB manufacturer string descriptor

config_element.name: USBProductString
config_element.label: Device product string descriptor
config_element.description_user: USB product string descriptor for the generic device

config_element.name: USBSerialNumberString
config_element.label: Device serial number string descriptor
config_element.description_user: USB serial number string descriptor for the generic device

config_element.name: USBConfigString
config_element.label: Device configuration string descriptor
config_element.description_user: USB configuration string descriptor for the generic device

config_element.name: USBVersion
config_element.label: USB version number
config_element.description_user: USB version number to which the devices conform, in binary-coded decimal

config_element.name: USBVendorID
config_element.label: USB Vendor ID
config_element.description_user: USB Vendor ID, as assigned by the USB-IF

config_element.name: USBProductID
config_element.label: The PID of the generic device
config_element.description_user: Product ID of the generic device

config_element.name: USBBCDDevice
config_element.label: Binary-coded decimal device version number
config_element.description_user: This version number can be used to select a driver. If it is not set here, the firmware will insert its build ID. The value supplied should be in the form 0xIJKL where I, J, K, L are in the range [0,9].

config_element.name: USBLangID
config_element.label: The USB language ID for string descriptors
config_element.description_user: In principle a device can support an arbitrary number of languages, but our firmware only supports up to one. If this value is zero, string descriptors won't be returned even if they're set. The values for English are the set {9 + n * 0x400 for n in [1,13]}. In particular, UK English is 0x0809 and US English is 0x0409. Since Microsoft Windows seems to ask for US English when reading serial number and product id, we are setting it to 0x0409 by default.

config_element.name: USBDeviceClassCodes
config_element.label: Class, subclass and protocol codes for the device
config_element.description_user:
Octet 1 is the class code, octet 2 is the subclass and octet 3 is the protocol code.
Note: the hub's class codes are fixed by the standard so they are hard-coded in the firmware.

config_element.name: USBMaxPower
config_element.label: Maximum power drawn by a bus-powered device
config_element.description_user: Specify the maximum power drawn by the device if it is bus-powered. Expressed in units of 2mA. (See USB2.0 standard, table 9-10.) If set to "0" device reports "Self-Powered" in the configuration descriptor regardless of USBSelfPowered MIB in Curator. This is recommended for compound devices by USB 2.0 standard: 11.13 Hub Configuration, the entire load is then reported in the hubs' configuration descriptor.

config_element.name: USBRemoteWakeDisable
config_element.label: Disables support for USB remote wake
config_element.description_user: If set the device will not advertize support for remote wake capability in its descriptors. By default remote wake is enabled.

config_element.name: SDHostSlot0
config_element.label: Initialise SD Host slot 0
config_element.description_user: This flag indicates if the application wishes to initialise SD Host slot 0. If set TRUE the application will request the PIOs for the SD slot 0 from the Curator. If the PIOs can't be allocated the application firmware will panic with the PANIC_SD_HOST_SUBRES_FAILED. The PIOs are hardcoded in the Curator.

config_element.name: SDHostSlot1
config_element.label: Initialise SD Host slot 1
config_element.description_user: This flag indicates if the application wishes to initialise SD Host slot 1. If set TRUE the application will request the PIOs for the SD slot 1 from the Curator. If the PIOs can't be allocated the application firmware will panic with ID PANIC_SD_HOST_SUBRES_FAILED. The PIOs are hardcoded in the Curator.

config_element.name: I2CPios
config_element.label: I2C PIOs configuration
config_element.description_user: A two element octet string used to set the PIO pins used by the I2C trap call StreamI2cSource and I2cTransfer. The first element gives the PIO number for the SCL signal and the second for the SDA.

config_element.name: FeatureLicenseKey
config_element.label: License Key for product feature
config_element.description_user: Octet string used to selectively enable product features.

config_element.name: DisableAppsFileserver
config_element.label: Disable the Apps patch/config fileserver
config_element.description_user: Stop the Apps subsystem serving patch and config files. Curator will serve them instead.

config_element.name: AppsP1InactiveTimer
config_element.label: Time (in milliseconds) to confirm if the application in Apps P1 is running or not.
config_element.description_user: If this MIB key value is non-zero, then Apps P0 shall restart the chip if the application running in the Apps P1 does not invoke VmSoftwareWdKick() trap after a chip reset within the time configured in this MIB key.

config_element.name: AudioPwmPios
config_element.label: Audio PWM PIOs configuration
config_element.description_user: A two element octet string used to specify the PIOs used for external Audio PWM amplifier. The first octet specifies the details of the amplifier's power enable pin (output from the chip) and the second octet for assert pin (input to the chip). The lower 7 bits of each octet specifies the PIO number and the upper 1 bit specifies active PIO level (0 - High, 1 - Low).

config_element.name: ThermalShutdownPeriod
config_element.label: Die temperature reading frequency in milliseconds.
config_element.description_user: This MIB key specifies how often the die temperature is checked for thermal protection when charging. The value 0 disables the thermal protection.

config_element.name: ThermalShutdownLongPeriod
config_element.label: Die temperature slower reading frequency in milliseconds.
config_element.description_user: This MIB key specifies how often the die temperature is checked for thermal protection when not charging. The value 0 disables the thermal protection.

config_element.name: ShutdownTemperature
config_element.label: Temperature in Celsius to turn-off the chip in Celsius.
config_element.description_user: This MIB key specifies the die temperature at which to turn off the chip.

config_element.name: RampDownTemperature
config_element.label: Temperature in Celsius to ramp down charging.
config_element.description_user: This MIB key specifies the die temperature at which to ramp down battery charging to 1/4 of current.

config_element.name: ReenableTemperature
config_element.label: Temperature in Celsius to re-enable charger.
config_element.description_user: This MIB key specifies the die temperature at which to re-enable battery charging.

config_element.name: ChargerMaximumCurrentTrickle
config_element.label: Maximum Trickle Charge Current.
config_element.description_user: This MIB key sets the maximum trickle charge current to use, which is dependent on the size and type of battery. The setting to use can be determined from the battery. The value 0 disables this limit.

config_element.name: ChargerMaximumCurrentPre
config_element.label: Maximum Pre Charge Current.
config_element.description_user: This MIB key sets the maximum pre charge current to use, which is dependent on the size and type of battery. The setting to use can be determined from the battery. The value 0 disables this limit.

config_element.name: ChargerMaximumCurrentFast
config_element.label: Maximum Fast Charge Current in mA.
config_element.description_user: This MIB key sets the maximum fast charge current to use, which is dependent on the size and type of battery. The setting to use can be determined from the battery. The value 0 disables this limit.

config_element.name: ChargerMaximumVoltage
config_element.label: Maximum charger output voltage in mV.
config_element.description_user: This MIB key controls the maximum output voltage from the charger.The charger can output between 3585mV and 4425mV.

config_element.name: NfcTxControlModulationDepth
config_element.label: Nfc Tx Control Modulation Depth
config_element.description_user:
This MIB key sets the TX modulation depth used by NFC hardware. The range is from 0 to 15. The default is stored in the NFC hardware. It is set to the best possible value for range performance and NFC forum compliance. It should not be changed.
WARNING: changing this value may improve the range with some NFC readers but it may also make the NFC subsystem uncompliant. Consequently, it is ONLY provided for experimentation.
An out of range value (E.g 0xff) means that the default NFC hardware value will be used.

config_element.name: NfcQuantConfig
config_element.label: NFC Quantizer Configuration Register
config_element.description_user:
This MIB key sets the NFC quantizer configuration register which sets the Hysterisis for noise removal. Options are 0-63 codes.
Usage: Too little - suffer loss of good packets as they get corrupted. Too much - get poor sensitivity.

config_element.name: NfcAgcControl2
config_element.label: NFC AGC Control2 Register
config_element.description_user:
Boosts the Tx Modulation depth.
Usage: Boosts TX amplitude on weak RF signals, 4 pairs of 2 bits. Larger the value the bigger the TX modulation.

config_element.name: AdcTemperatureMultiplier
config_element.label: Multiplicative factor for aux_adc temperature measurement.
config_element.description_user:
This value is used to multiply the raw temperature reading derived from the hardware in the chip's AUX macro to give a value where differences between readings are in degrees Celsius. The value AdcTemperatureAddition is added to the result to convert to degrees Celsius.
This value is a signed 32-bit integer in two's complement representation. It represents a fixed point number found by shifting right by 16 bits. Hence the top 16 bits of the number stored in the MIB represent the integer part of the resulting number while the lower 16 bits a fractional part. For example, 0x000A0000 represents the integer 10 and 0xFFFFC000 represents -1/4.
This key must be set for temperature compensation to be performed.

config_element.name: AdcTemperatureAddition
config_element.label: Additive constant for the aux_adc temperature measurement.
config_element.description_user:
This value is added to the result of using the MIB attribute AdcTemperatureMultiplier to give a temperature in degrees Celsius from the chip's AUX macro.
The value is 16-bit signed integer: there is no fractional part as the temperature accuracy is not expected to be better than one degree Celsius.
The default is zero: this allows a value of AdcTemperatureMultiplier to be set and a reading performed to compare the measured temperature with the known ambient temperature in order to set the correct value of AdcTemperatureAddition.
This key must be set for temperature compensation to be performed.

config_element.name: XtalTemperatureLookupTable
config_element.label: Lookup table for compensating crystal for temperature
config_element.description_user:
If this MIB key is set, temperature compensation may be performed on the crystal that supplies the system clock. The value gives an array of mappings from temperature to the internal units used for determining the capacitance fine trim applied to the crystal.
Each entry consists of 3 octets supplying one 8-bit integer and one 16-bit integer. The first entry is a signed 8-bit integer giving absolute temperature in degrees Celsius. Range for it is -128 to +127. The second entry is a signed 16-bit integer giving delta to the original trim value. Range for it is -32768 to +32767.
Outside the range of the minimum and maximum temperature given, no extrapolation is performed: the corresponding delta to original fine trim for the minimum temperature is used for all lower temperatures, and that for the maximum temperature is used for all higher temperatures.
Within the range of the temperatures in the table, piecewise linear interpolation is performed between adjacent temperature values to determine the appropriate delta to original fine trim.
This key must be set for temperature compensation to be performed.
config_element.default: [d3 ff ba d8 ff c9 dd ff d7 e2 ff e3 e7 ff ec f1 ff fd fb 00 04 05 00 05 0f 00 03 19 ff fd 23 ff f8 2c ff f2 36 ff f0 40 ff f4 4a ff ff 55 00 15]

config_element.name: XtalTemperatureDACConversion
config_element.label: Number of fine steps equivalent to 1 coarse step.
config_element.description_user: For every delta within fine DAC range the coarse DAC also needs to be modified. This defines the number of fine DAC steps equating to 1 coarse DAC step.

config_element.name: XtalTemperaturePeriod
config_element.label: Period of crystal temperature compensation mechanism in milliseconds.
config_element.description_user:
If the crystal temperature compensation mechanism is in use this key determines the period between AUX temperature measurements made. If used the recommended period is 10000 milliseconds
The value 0 disables the crystal temperature compensation.

config_element.name: AdcReadDelay
config_element.label: Delay in microseconds to be used before taking ADC reading.
config_element.description_user: Adc reading for various analogue sources require a delay before actual reading is done. This is to let noise due to internal switches and transients due to stray capacitance to settle down and not impact the reading. The default is 15000 microsecond.

config_element.name: InitialLogLevels
config_element.label: MIB key to set log levels during boot up
config_element.description_user: Pair of module numbers with their log level. Octet 1 is the module number, octet 2 is the log level and the sequence continues. Can hold upto 64 pairs of module numbers with their log level.

config_element.name: EnableTRBLog
config_element.label: MIB to enable TRB logging
config_element.description_user: This MIB key enables/disables TRB logging. Usage: true - enables TRB logging. false - disables TRB logging.

config_element.name: AuthenticateROFS
config_element.label: Authenticate Apps read-only filesystem.
config_element.description_user: Controls whether authentication of the read only filesystem is required. If this key is set to TRUE then the hash of the filesystem will be checked before it is used and the device will panic with code PANIC_FLASH_SECTION_AUTHENTICATION_FAILED.

config_element.name: SiflashResumeToSuspendDelay
config_element.label: Minimum delay in microseconds after Write/Erase Resume and before Write/Erase Suspend for siflash operation.
config_element.description_user: Some devices require a minimum delay after resuming suspended write/erase and before issuing another write/erase suspend. The default value is chosen conservatively to work with most devices and can be decreased if particular flash can tolerate smaller delay.

config_element.name: SiflashSuspendResumeCommands
config_element.label: Command codes for write/erase suspend and resume siflash operations.

config_element.name: SiflashPageSize
config_element.label: Write page size for siflash operations.
config_element.description_user: Write page size for siflash page program command.

config_element.name: SiflashEraseRegion0
config_element.label: Specifies erase region #0 for siflash operations.
config_element.description_user:
Siflash needs to know erase command code and erase block size. Some devices have non-uniform organization, so different commands might be needed for different regions of flash.
The value is encoded as follows: MSB 8 bit: erase command code; 8 bit: erase block size exponent (e.g. 16 means 2^16=64KB erase block size). LSB 16 bit: erase region size, in erase blocks, 0xffff means the region spans until the end of device.
Erase regions #0...#3 follow one after another and should cover the whole device. If less than 4 erase regions are needed, when those at the end can be left undefined.
If all erase regions undefined, erase block parameters are obtained from Curator, otherwise Curator settings are ignored.
Example: 0xD8100100 - erase command code 0xD8, block size 10^16 = 64KB, region size is 256 blocks of size 64KB: 16MB.

config_element.name: SiflashEraseRegion1
config_element.label: Specifies erase region #1 for siflash operations.
config_element.description_user: Refer to description for SiflashEraseRegion0.

config_element.name: SiflashEraseRegion2
config_element.label: Specifies erase region #2 for siflash operations.
config_element.description_user: Refer to description for SiflashEraseRegion0.

config_element.name: SiflashEraseRegion3
config_element.label: Specifies erase region #3 for siflash operations.
config_element.description_user: Refer to description for SiflashEraseRegion0.

config_element.name: ResetOnChargerAttach
config_element.label: MIB to enable chip reset on attaching a charger.
config_element.description_user: This key, when TRUE, resets the chip when a charger is connected. When FALSE, the chip doesn't reset when a charger is connected.

config_element.name: AudioQSPIBankBAddr
config_element.label: Specifies the DFU bank B start address for audio QSPI device.
config_element.description_user: This key specifies the Device Firmware Upgrade (DFU) bank B start address of the audio image in the Audio QSPI (external flash) device. For the audio DFU to work, the value set in this MIB key shall be more than the maximum size of the audio image.

config_element.name: UsbTypeCCCSource
config_element.label: USB Type-C CC line source.
config_element.description_user: This MIB key specifies the PIO number which is connected to CC line. An out of range value (e.g. 0xff) means that the USB Type-C support does not exist.

config_element.name: CcVoltageThresholdAt500mAMin
config_element.label: Specifies the minimum threshold voltage at default current.
config_element.description_user: USB Type-C specification 1.2, table 4-27, specifies multiple source current advertisement. Due to external resistor, voltage range of default current advertisement differs. This MIB key is used to specify the minimum threshold voltage (mV) when source advertises default current.

config_element.name: CcVoltageThresholdAt500mAMax
config_element.label: Specifies the maximum threshold voltage at default current.
config_element.description_user:
USB Type-C specification 1.2, table 4-27, specifies multiple source current advertisement. Due to external resistor, voltage range of default current advertisement differs. This MIB key is used to specify the maximum threshold voltage (mV) when source advertises default current.
The default value is set considering external resistor is 100Kohm. The maximum value of this MIB key can be 660 (as per USB Type-C specification).

config_element.name: CcVoltageThresholdAt1500mAMin
config_element.label: Specifies the minimum threshold voltage at 1500 mA current.
config_element.description_user:
USB Type-C specification 1.2, table 4-27, specifies multiple source current advertisement. Due to external resistor, voltage range of 1500 mA current advertisement differs. This MIB key is used to specify the minimum threshold voltage (mV) when source advertises 1500 mA current.
The default value is set considering external resistor is 100Kohm.

config_element.name: CcVoltageThresholdAt1500mAMax
config_element.label: Specifies the maximum threshold voltage at 1500 mA current.
config_element.description_user:
USB Type-C specification 1.2, table 4-27, specifies multiple source current advertisement. Due to external resistor, voltage range of 1500 mA current advertisement differs. This MIB key is used to specify the maximum threshold voltage (mV) when source advertises 1500 mA current.
The default is set considering external resistor is 100Kohm. The maximum value of this MIB key can be 1230 (as per USB Type-C specification).

config_element.name: CcVoltageThresholdAt3000mAMin
config_element.label: Specifies the minimum threshold voltage at 1500 mA current.
config_element.description_user:
USB Type-C specification 1.2, table 4-27, specifies multiple source current advertisement. Due to external resistor, voltage range of 3000 mA current advertisement differs. This MIB key is used to specify the minimum threshold voltage (mV) when source advertises 3000 mA current.
The default is set considering external resistor is 100Kohm.

config_element.name: CcVoltageThresholdAt3000mAMax
config_element.label: Specifies the maximum threshold voltage at 1500 mA current.
config_element.description_user:
USB Type-C specification 1.2, table 4-27, specifies multiple source current advertisement. Due to external resistor, voltage range of 3000 mA current advertisement differs. This MIB key is used to specify the maximum threshold voltage (mV) when source advertises 3000 mA current.
The default value is set considering external resistor is 100Kohm. The maximum value of this MIB key can be 2040 (as per USB Type-C specification).

config_element.name: IpcLeaveRecvBufferPagesMapped
config_element.label: Leaves IPC receive buffer pages mapped in.
config_element.description_user: When this key is set to true pages no longer in use by the IPC receive buffer will not be freed. This means old messages are still visible to the debugger after they have been processed by the IPC module, making debugging IPC related issues easier.

config_element.name: SDHostSlot0Pio
config_element.label: PIO Config for Slot 0
config_element.description_user: The PIO numbers to use for Slot 0 configuration. The string is defined as the pio nr for [ Card Detect, Write Protect, Card Enable ] Card Detect - PIO input for card detection. A value of 0xFF will ignore hot insertion and treat the card state as always inserted. Write Protect - PIO input for write protect detect. A value of 0xFF ignores the field. Card Enable - PIO output driven before SD operation. A value of 0xFF ignores the field. If the PIOs cannot be allocated the firmware will panic with ID PANIC_SD_HOST_SUBRES_FAILED. SDHostSlot0 should be enabled for this to take effect.

config_element.name: SDHostSlot1Pio
config_element.label: PIO Config for Slot 1
config_element.description_user: The PIO numbers to use for Slot 1 configuration. A value of 0xFF ignores the field. The string is defined as the pio nr for [ Card Detect, Write Protect, Card Enable ] Card Detect - PIO input for card detection. A value of 0xFF will ignore hot insertion and treat the card state as always inserted. Write Protect - PIO input for write protect detect. A value of 0xFF ignores the field. Card Enable - PIO output driven before SD operation. A value of 0xFF ignores the field. If the PIOs cannot be allocated the firmware will panic with ID PANIC_SD_HOST_SUBRES_FAILED. SDHostSlot1 should be enabled for this to take effect.

config_element.name: CustomerReadOnlyKey0
config_element.label: ReadOnly Customer Key 0
config_element.description_user: This key is reserved for the Customer's use. This implements read-only storage which the customer application can retrieve via the PsFullRetrieve trap as PSKEY_READONLY0

config_element.name: CustomerReadOnlyKey1
config_element.label: ReadOnly Customer Key 1
config_element.description_user: This key is reserved for the Customer's use. This implements read-only storage which the customer application can retrieve via the PsFullRetrieve trap as PSKEY_READONLY1

config_element.name: CustomerReadOnlyKey2
config_element.label: ReadOnly Customer Key 2
config_element.description_user: This key is reserved for the Customer's use. This implements read-only storage which the customer application can retrieve via the PsFullRetrieve trap as PSKEY_READONLY2

config_element.name: CustomerReadOnlyKey3
config_element.label: ReadOnly Customer Key 3
config_element.description_user: This key is reserved for the Customer's use. This implements read-only storage which the customer application can retrieve via the PsFullRetrieve trap as PSKEY_READONLY3

config_element.name: CustomerReadOnlyKey4
config_element.label: ReadOnly Customer Key 4
config_element.description_user: This key is reserved for the Customer's use. This implements read-only storage which the customer application can retrieve via the PsFullRetrieve trap as PSKEY_READONLY4

config_element.name: CustomerReadOnlyKey5
config_element.label: ReadOnly Customer Key 5
config_element.description_user: This key is reserved for the Customer's use. This implements read-only storage which the customer application can retrieve via the PsFullRetrieve trap as PSKEY_READONLY5

config_element.name: CustomerReadOnlyKey6
config_element.label: ReadOnly Customer Key 6
config_element.description_user: This key is reserved for the Customer's use. This implements read-only storage which the customer application can retrieve via the PsFullRetrieve trap as PSKEY_READONLY6

config_element.name: CustomerReadOnlyKey7
config_element.label: ReadOnly Customer Key 7
config_element.description_user: This key is reserved for the Customer's use. This implements read-only storage which the customer application can retrieve via the PsFullRetrieve trap as PSKEY_READONLY7

config_element.name: CustomerReadOnlyKey8
config_element.label: ReadOnly Customer Key 8
config_element.description_user: This key is reserved for the Customer's use. This implements read-only storage which the customer application can retrieve via the PsFullRetrieve trap as PSKEY_READONLY8

config_element.name: CustomerReadOnlyKey9
config_element.label: ReadOnly Customer Key 9
config_element.description_user: This key is reserved for the Customer's use. This implements read-only storage which the customer application can retrieve via the PsFullRetrieve trap as PSKEY_READONLY9

config_element.name: StreamFilesystemEnable
config_element.label: Enables the StreamFilesystemSource and StreamFilesystemSink traps.
config_element.description_user:
When this key is set to true the StreamFilesystemSource and StreamFilesystemSink traps are enabled, making it possible to update the device read only config filesystem whilst the application subsystem is running.
Since this key allows read / write access from / to filesystems that may contain sensitive data the key is disabled by default and must be explicitly enabled for use on the production line and disabled before the product is released.

config_element.name: SDHost1BitOnlySlot0
config_element.label: Restrict SD/MMC operation to 1-bit on Slot 0
config_element.description_user: When this is set to true, the SD Host Controller will restrict Slot 0 to 1-bit data operation. Certain package variants do not have sufficient number of pins for typical 4-bit SD/MMC operation. On such packages, this mib should be set to true, to ensure that only CMD, CLK and D0 lines are used. D1-3 will be unavailable

config_element.name: SDHost1BitOnlySlot1
config_element.label: Restrict SD/MMC operation to 1-bit on Slot 1
config_element.description_user: When this is set to true, the SD Host Controller will restrict Slot 1 to 1-bit data operation. Certain package variants do not have sufficient number of pins for typical 4-bit SD/MMC operation. On such packages, this mib should be set to true, to ensure that only CMD, CLK and D0 lines are used. D1-3 will be unavailable

config_element.name: CcDefaultPollPeriod
config_element.label: Polling period when drawing default current.
config_element.description_user:
USB Type-C specification does not require device to start drawing higher current once allowed to do so by the CC-line state. It is up to device when to do the switch.
To save power default period is chosen to be 1000ms, it can be either increased or decreased depending on the application.
Period value is in milliseconds.

config_element.name: CcFastPollPeriod
config_element.label: Polling period when drawing 1.5A/3.0A current.
config_element.description_user:
USB Type-C specification Table 4-20: tSinkAdj max time is 60 msec.
If device is drawing 1.5A/3.0A, it has to react within 60ms to any change in the state of CC-line by adjusting the current drawn from VBUS.
ADC unit is used to measure voltage level on CC-line. The measurement can take up to 4ms and can be delayd if there is another ADC measurement in progress. Default value is chosen to be 20ms to leave some room for delays.
Period value is in milliseconds.
